1.text: Win money by betting on what numbers are rolled on a pair of dice.

2.text: Place a bet on the pass line to play during the come-out roll.

3.text: Play the point if no one wins or loses on the come-out roll.

4.text: Place a come bet if the come-out roll has already happened.

5.text: Start with conservative, basic bets when you begin playing.

6.text: Roll the dice across the table when the stickperson hands them to you.

7.text: Identify the casino personnel operating the craps table.

8.text: Stand behind the pass line when approaching the table.

9.text: Get some chips at the table before you play.

10.text: Cheer for other players at the table as they roll.

11.text: Ask the dealers to help you place bets in off-limits spots on the table.

12.text: Memorize the odds to increase your chances of winning.

13.text: Master some of the common lingo to have an easier time betting.

14.text: Use the field numbers to predict the next roll.

15.text: Use the top row of numbers for a place bet.

16.text: Lay chips below your pass line bet if you wish to make an odds bet.

17.text: Make proposition bets in the middle of the table.
